name: Eggplant Salad Dip
author: evel
summary: Makes for a delicious app at a party or an easy weekday lunch, also delicious as a side dish with grilled meats, chicken, or falafels. We love it so much we eat it by the spoonful! Always a hit, everyone asks for the recipe. Keeps well in the fridge, just leave out a few minutes before eating. Double the recipe if you want leftovers! Serve with crostini, pita chips, crackers, even soft French bread or pita.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 medium lemon, zested and juiced, divided
1 tablespoon honey, or more to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Slice eggplant in half lengthwise and score the flesh
Rub the flesh with salt and pepper and brush with 1 tablespoon olive oil
Place flesh down on the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until it remains depressed when you poke the skin, 35 to 40 minutes
Remove from the oven and let rest for 15 minutes
Use a fork to scrape the flesh away from the skins and into a large bowl
Add parsley, cilantro, mint, onion, garlic, and lemon zest
Whisk remaining 3 tablespoons oil, lemon juice, honey, and vinegar together until just combined
Add to eggplant mixture and mix well
Season with salt and pepper and let rest 30 minutes before serving
